You will not get paid for delivering cargo if any of the cargo goes missing or gets damaged during the transport. Generating more power than the devices in the submarine are consuming may damage junction boxes or cause fires. Junction boxes and other electrical devices may get damaged if they stay submerged too long. Letting the submarine's nuclear reactor overheat may cause fires. If an overheated reactor is not shut down, it will eventually lead to a nuclear meltdown. Most submarines are equipped with stationary batteries that can be used as a temporary source of backup power in the case of a reactor failure. Railgun shells and depth charges include a compartment that can hold additional explosives. Passive sonar can be used to detect nearby sound sources without attracting unwanted attention. You can also get a rough idea of your surroundings based on the sounds reflected from the ice walls. There are many ways to get past locked doors, including forcing them open with a crowbar or rewiring them to a button you have access to. Stationary batteries are equipped with docks that can be used to charge battery cells. Oxygen generators are equipped with docks that can be used to refill oxygen tanks. Supercapacitors can deliver large bursts of power, but cannot store as much energy as batteries. They are often used to power railguns and other devices that require brief bursts of high current. Nuclear reactors are equipped with an automatic control system that adjusts the power output to a suitable level when enabled. However, the system is not always fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption. The sonar imaging on the navigation terminal may become inaccurate if the terminal is damaged—make sure your engineers keep the terminal in a good condition! When deploying a decoy, be sure to deactivate your active sonar for best results. Attempting to rewire powered devices without adequate electrical engineering skills may get you electrocuted. Welding tools are simple enough to be used by any submariner, but trained mechanics are generally faster welders and have a lower risk of injuring themselves with the tool. All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on electrical devices, but electrical engineers get the job done much faster. All submariners have been trained to do basic repairs on mechanical devices, but mechanics get the job done much faster. Captains are generally much more adept at maneuvering the submarine than the average sailor. If the reactor on a sub is not able to produce sufficient power to run all onboard systems, try reducing the charge rate for the onboard batteries and supercapacitors, or regulate the times when the sub is running at full speed. The electrical and mechanical systems on a sub will gradually degrade due to the harsh conditions and constant wear and tear. Be sure to have mechanics and engineers perform maintenance from time to time in order to avoid breakdowns at inopportune moments. Breaking down alien artifacts in a deconstructor may provide you with exotic raw materials. Some of the alien structures on Europa have been constructed of a metamaterial that's outstandingly resistant to physical damage, and as such has become an important subject of research to Europan scientists. Special caution must be taken when bringing alien artifacts on board the submarine. Very little is known of the presumably extinct alien civilization that built the ruins scattered all across Europa. The age of the ruins is also a mystery, since the self-repairing properties of the structures and devices make chronological dating methods wildly inaccurate. No remains of the alien lifeforms that built the ruins scattered all across Europa have ever been discovered. The only life encountered inside the structures are the biomechanical entities that maintain and guard them. While exploring ruins or caves, drop flares as often as possible to help mark a path out, should you need to make a hasty exit for some reason. The cephalopod-like watchers are generally docile, but may attack when provoked. Cannibalistic behavior is very common among crawlers. Killing one in a swarm may distract the rest as they enter into a feeding frenzy. Mud raptors can easily tear their way through metal doors with their sharp beaks. The so-called husk parasites slowly take over and consume the body of their host, eventually turning them into nothing but an empty exoskeleton controlled by the parasite. Many creatures on Europa are protected by a strong shell, and are difficult to damage with conventional weapons, though there may be weak points in their armor. Loud devices and sonar pings may alert nearby creatures. Performing CPR without adequate medical skills may cause internal damage to the patient. Opiates such as morphine and fentanyl are an effective way of treating injuries in an emergency, but regular use may eventually lead to a state of addiction and cause dangerous withdrawal symptoms. Morbusine is a neurotoxin potent enough to take down even some of the largest Europan predators. A trained medical doctor can manufacture it relatively easily using a medical fabricator. Bleeding wounds can be treated with bandages and hemostatic agents. The patient may also need saline or blood packs to replace the lost blood. Mental disorders such as psychosis are unfortunately common among submarine crews, particularly after ruin expeditions. If your crewmates start seeing or hearing things others don't see or hear, report it to a medical doctor immediately. The medical doctors' main task is to keep the crew in a good shape, but a medic with a syringe gun and a bit of knowhow on poisons can also be very useful in fending off intruders. Administering drugs without sufficient medical knowledge may reduce the number of doses a single syringe provides, and may also reduce the quality of the effects of the drug. Many drugs may have unintended side effects. Keep an eye on the patient and be ready to administer additional medications to counteract these side effects if necessary. When using a diving mask, be careful not to mix up welding fuel tanks and oxygen tanks. Diving masks let you breathe underwater, but don't offer any protection against the bone-crushing pressure outside the submarine. If there's a major hull breach, find a diving suit immediately. In the event of a fire, burns are not the only thing to watch out for—fires can quickly consume all the oxygen inside the submarine. Traversing the so-called Hydrothermal Wastes requires special caution. Not only are they abundant in wildlife, but the water currents caused by geothermal activity make navigation even more hazardous. Some of the sessile lifeforms in Europa emit low-frequency sounds that may disrupt the submarine's sonar. Be careful not to dive too deep. Most submarine hulls will start collapsing at the depth of approximately 2,000 meters. Europa is rich in natural resources, and an enterprising captain with a sharp eye and a plasma cutter may stand to make a tidy profit. You can disguise yourself as someone else by wearing their ID card and something that covers your face. It's possible to build voice-controlled systems by linking wifi components to the radio chat in the submarine editor. The radiation belts around Jupiter make it impracticable to establish permanent settlements above Europa's surface, and as such almost all Europan outposts are located below its icy crust. The dynamics of Europa's underwater ecosystem are still not fully understood, but it is believed that the base of the food chain is mostly formed by chemosynthetic bacteria. The Europa Coalition started off as a trade and cooperation agreement between the two largest Europan settlements and a handful of private paramilitary groups, but gradually grew to become what is essentially the Europan government. The much-ridiculed initiative to help submariners cope in a high-stress environment by including professional entertainers in the crews was promptly deemed a failure and discontinued. Most vessels avoid venturing outside the tunnels and cracks within Europa's icy crust—the vast, empty Abyss between the surface layers and the rocky interior hosts many of Europa's largest and most dangerous inhabitants.

Server name Server port The port used to communicate with clients. If clients fail to connect to your server, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually. Query port The port used to communicate with Steam's server browser and respond to info pings from clients. If clients don't see your server in the server list or if authenticating their Steam ID fails, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding or forward the port manually. Max players Password Public server Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the 'Server Browser'. Attempt UPnP port forwarding UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players to join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions). Start Please wait... Single Player Tutorial Dev Sandbox Sandbox Mission Campaign Embark on a journey through the depths of Europa. Travel from location to location, complete missions to earn money for supplies, discover new biomes… A game mode with no specific objectives. The crew must work together to complete a single mission, such as retrieving an alien artifact or killing a creature that's terrorizing nearby outposts. Embark on a journey through the depths of Europa. Travel from location to location, complete missions to earn money for supplies, discover new biomes…

Core package Core packages are special content packages that contain all the core files (executables, configuration files) the game won't run without. There must always be one (and only one) core package selected. Only select this if you wish to create a mod that replaces all the Vanilla files. Mods that only add things to the Vanilla game (or another core package) should not be marked as core packages. Graphics Resolution Display mode Fullscreen Windowed Borderless windowed Enable vertical sync Synchronizes the game's frame rate with your monitor's refresh rate. Helps prevent screen tearing artifacts. Particle limit Line of sight effect None Transparent Opaque Lighting resolution Lower values improve performance, but cause shadows to appear more pixellated. Specular lighting Enables specular lighting, an effect which creates brighter spots of light on shiny objects. Chromatic aberration Enables a subtle color distortion effect at the edges of the screen. HUD scale Inventory scale
Audio Sound volume Music volume Voice chat volume Mute on focus lost Mutes the game when its window is not in focus. Dynamic range compression Adjusts the game's volume automatically to prevent audio distortion. Directional voice chat When enabled, voice chat messages are panned according to the direction of the speaker relative to your position.
Microphone volume Current device This device will be used for voice chat. Unfortunately there is no way to change the input device on Mac OS X—it will only use your system's default. Refresh default device Refreshes the input device used for voice chat. If you swap/hotplug the default input on your system then press this to detect that change. Disabled Voice chat is disabled. Push-to-talk Voice activity is sent only when a certain key is held down. Voice activity Voice activity is sent whenever the sound coming through surpasses the noise gate threshold. Noise gate threshold No audio capture devices found Voice chat attenuation Lowers the game's volume when players are speaking.
Controls Aim assist Affects how close the cursor has to be to an item to highlight it. If set to 0%, the cursor has to be exactly on the item. Enable mouse look When enabled, the camera moves according to the direction you point the cursor to. Save submarine Name Description Settings Save assembly Hide in menus Name Description Name your item assembly before saving it. There's already an item assembly with the same name. Do you want to replace the existing assembly? Illegal symbols in filename ([illegalchar]) No hulls found in the submarine. Hulls determine the 'borders' of an individual room and are required for water and air distribution to work correctly. The submarine contains vents which haven't been linked to an oxygen generator. Select a vent and click an oxygen generator while holding space to link them. The submarine contains [itemname]s which haven't been linked to an ammunition loader. Select the item and click a loader while holding space to link them. No waypoints found in the submarine. AI controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints. The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its spawn type' parameter to 'cargo'. One or more structures/items have been placed very far from the submarine. Do you want to move the camera to them? This submarine was saved using an older version of Barotrauma, which used a different formula to calculate lighting. The lighting in the submarine may now appear too bright. Do you want to automatically readjust the lighting for the new lighting formula? The brightness of the lights has been adjusted. Areas with multiple light sources may still appear too bright and require reducing the range or brightness of the lights manually. You may also use the console command 'multiplylights' to adjust the brightness of all the lights as once. For example, 'multiplylights 1,1,1,0.5' would decrease the brightness by 50%. You should add the tag 'ballast' to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine. No names given to any of the hulls, using autogenerated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting things such as hull breaches. Level Object Amount The total number of level objects (vegetation, vents, etc) in the level. Min Width

Voronoi Site Interval How far from each other voronoi sites are placed. Sites determine shape of the voronoi graph which the level walls are generated from. (Decreasing this value causes the number of sites, and the complexity of the level, to increase exponentially - be careful when adjusting) Voronoi Site Variance How much random variation to apply to the positions of the voronoi sites on each axis. Small values produce roughly rectangular level walls. The larger the values are, the less uniform the shapes get. Cell Subdivision Length The edges of the individual wall cells are subdivided into edges of this size. Can be used in conjunction with the rounding values to make the cells rounder. Smaller values will make the cells look smoother, but make the level more performance-intensive as the number of polygons used in rendering and physics calculations increases. Cell Rounding Amount How much the individual wall cells are rounded. Note that the final shape of the cells is also affected by the CellSubdivisionLength parameter. Cell Irregularity How much random variance is applied to the edges of the cells. Note that the final shape of the cells is also affected by the CellSubdivisionLength parameter. Main Path Node Interval Range The distance between the nodes that are used to generate the main path through the level (min, max). Larger values produce a straighter path. Small Tunnel Count The number of small tunnels placed along the main path. Small Tunnel Length Range The minimum and maximum length of small tunnels placed along the main path. Item Count
Floating Ice Chunk Count
Sea Floor Depth How far below the level the sea floor is placed. Sea Floor Variance Variance of the depth of the sea floor. Smaller values produce a smoother sea floor. Mountain Count Min The minimum number of mountains on the sea floor. Mountain Count Max The maximum number of mountains on the sea floor. Mountain Height Min The minimum height of the mountains on the sea floor. Mountain Height Max The maximum height of the mountains on the sea floor. Ruin Count The number of alien ruins in the level. Bottom Hole Probability The probability for wall cells to be removed from the bottom of the map. A value of 0 will produce a completely enclosed tunnel and 1 will make the entire bottom of the level completely open. Water Particle Scale Scale of the water particle texture. Min Size
Max Size
Alignment Which sides of a wall the object can spawn on. Spawn Pos
Depth Range
Clustering Amount The tendency for the prefab to form clusters. Used as an exponent for perlin noise values that are used to determine the probability for an object to spawn at a specific position. Clustering Group A value between 0-1 that determines the z-coordinate to sample perlin noise from when determining the probability for an object to spawn at a specific position. Using the same (or close) value for different objects means the objects tend to form clusters in the same areas. Align With Surface Should the object be rotated to align it with the wall surface it spawns on. Min Surface Width Minimum length of a graph edge the object can spawn on. Random Rotation How much the rotation of the object can vary (min and max values in degrees). Swing Amount How much the object swings (in degrees). Swing Frequency How fast the object swings. Scale Oscillation How much the scale of the object oscillates on each axis. A value of 0.5,0.5 would make the object's scale oscillate from 100% to 150%. Scale Oscillation Frequency How fast the object's scale oscillates. Commonness How likely it is for the object to spawn in a level. This is relative to the commonness of the other objects - for example, having an object with a commonness of 1 and another with a commonness of 10 would mean the latter appears in levels 10 times as frequently as the former. The commonness value can be overridden on specific level types. Sonar Disruption How much the object disrupts submarine's sonar. Frequency The frequency of the noise. Amplitude How much the noise distorts the sprite. Change Speed How fast the noise changes. Sync

Container Color Changes the color of the item this item is contained inside. Only has an effect if either of the UseContainedSpriteColor or UseContainedInventoryIconColor property of the container is set to true. Condition
Tags
Display Side By Side When Linked Enable if you want to display the item HUD side by side with another item's HUD, when linked together. Disclaimer: It's possible or even likely that the views block each other, if they were not designed to be viewed together! Sprite Depth
Item Pos The position where the contained items get drawn at (offset from the upper left corner of the sprite in pixels). Item Interval The interval at which the contained items are spaced apart from each other (in pixels). Containable Restrictions Define items (by identifiers or tags) that bots should place inside this container. If empty, no restrictions are applied. Is Toggle When enabled, the item will continuously send out a 0/1 signal and interacting with it will flip the signal (making the item behave like a switch). When disabled, the item will simply send out 1 when interacted with. Locked Locked connection panels cannot be rewired in-game. Hold Pos The position the character holds the item at (in pixels, as an offset from the character's shoulder). For example, a value of 10,-100 would make the character hold the item 100 pixels below the shoulder and 10 pixels forwards. Hold Angle The rotation at which the character holds the item (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand). Swing Amount How much the item swings around when aiming/holding it (in pixels, as an offset from AimPos/HoldPos). Swing Speed How fast the item swings around when aiming/holding it (only valid if SwingAmount is set). Swing When Holding Should the item swing around when it's being held. Swing When Aiming Should the item swing around when it's being aimed. Swing When Using Should the item swing around when it's being used (for example, when firing a weapon or a welding tool). Opening Speed How quickly the door opens. Closing Speed How quickly the door closes. Is Open Is the door currently open. Deterioration Speed How fast the condition of the item deteriorates per second. Min Deterioration Delay Minimum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate. Max Deterioration Delay Maximum initial delay before the item starts to deteriorate. Min Deterioration Condition The item won't deteriorate spontaneously if the condition is below this value. For example, if set to 10, the condition will spontaneously drop to 10 and then stop dropping (unless the item is damaged further by external factors). Percentages of max condition. Show Repair U I Threshold The condition of the item has to be below this before the repair UI becomes usable. Percentages of max condition. Fix Duration Low Skill The amount of time it takes to fix the item with insufficient skill levels. Fix Duration High Skill The amount of time it takes to fix the item with sufficient skill levels. Drop Shadow Offset The position of the drop shadow relative to the structure. If set to zero, the shadow is positioned automatically so that it points towards the sub's center of mass. Scale

Range The range of the emitted light. Higher values are more performance-intensive. Cast Shadows Should structures cast shadows when light from this light source hits them. Disabling shadows increases the performance of the game, and is recommended for lights with a short range. Draw Behind Subs Lights drawn behind submarines don't cast any shadows and are much faster to draw than shadow-casting lights. It's recommended to enable this on decorative lights outside the submarine's hull. Is On Is the light currently on. Blink Frequency How rapidly the light blinks on and off (in Hz). 0 = no blinking. Neutral Ballast Level How full the ballast tanks should be when the submarine is not being steered upwards/downwards. Can be used to compensate if the ballast tanks are too large/small relative to the size of the submarine. Use Transducers Does the sonar have to be connected to external transducers to work. Text The text displayed in the label. Text Color The color of the text displayed on the label (R,G,B,A). Text Scale The scale of the text displayed on the label. Require Water Detectors Does the machine require inputs from water detectors in order to show the water levels inside rooms. Require Oxygen Detectors Does the machine require inputs from oxygen detectors in order to show the oxygen levels inside rooms. Show Hull Integrity Should damaged walls be displayed by the machine. Max Power Output How much power (kW) the reactor generates when operating at full capacity. Meltdown Delay How long the temperature has to stay critical until a meltdown occurs. Fire Delay How long the temperature has to stay critical until the reactor catches fire. Fuel Consumption Rate How fast the condition of the contained fuel rods deteriorates per second. Max Out Put Maximum output of the device when fully charged (kW). Capacity The maximum capacity of the device (kW * min). For example, a value of 1000 means the device can output 100 kilowatts of power for 10 minutes, or 1000 kilowatts for 1 minute. Charge The current charge of the device. Max Recharge Speed How fast the device can be recharged. For example, a recharge speed of 100 kW and a capacity of 1000 kW*min would mean it takes 10 minutes to fully charge the device. Recharge Speed The current recharge speed of the device. Generated Amount How much oxygen the machine generates when operating at full power. Max Force The amount of force exerted on the submarine when the engine is operating at full power. Propeller Pos The position of the propeller as an offset from the item's center (in pixels). Determines where the particles spawn and the position that causes characters to take damage from the engine if the PropellerDamage is defined. Life Time How many seconds the particle remains alive. Start Delay Min How long it takes for the particle to appear after spawning it. Start Delay Max How long it takes for the particle to appear after spawning it. Angular Velocity Min
Angular Velocity Max
Start Rotation Min The minimum initial rotation of the particle (in degrees). Start Rotation Max The maximum initial rotation of the particle (in degrees). Rotate To Direction Should the particle face the direction it's moving towards. Drag Drag applied to the particle when it's moving through air. Water Drag Drag applied to the particle when it's moving through water. Velocity Change How much the velocity of the particle changes per second. Velocity Change Water How much the velocity of the particle changes per second when in water. Collision Radius Use Collision Does the particle collide with the walls of the submarine and the level. Delete On Collision Does the particle disappear when it collides with something. Friction The friction coefficient of the particle, i.e. how much it slows down when it's sliding against a surface. Restitution How much of the particle's velocity is conserved when it collides with something, i.e. the bounciness of the particle. (1.0 = the particle stops completely). Start Size Min The minimum initial size of the particle. Start Size Max The maximum initial size of the particle. Size Change Min How much the size of the particle changes per second. The rate of growth for each particle is randomize between SizeChangeMin and SizeChangeMax. Size Change Max How much the size of the particle changes per second. The rate of growth for each particle is randomize between SizeChangeMin and SizeChangeMax. Grow Time How many seconds it takes for the particle to grow to it's initial size. Start Color The initial color of the particle. End Color The color of the particle at the end of its lifetime. Draw Target Should the particle be rendered in air, water or both. Blend State The type of blending to use when rendering the particle. Anim Duration The duration of the particle's animation cycle (if it's animated). Loop Anim Should the sprite animation be looped, or stay at the last frame when the animation finishes. Room Name

Delay How long the item delays the signals (in seconds). Reset When Signal Received Should the component discard previously received signals when a new one is received. Reset When Different Signal Received Should the component discard previously received signals when the incoming signal changes. Time Frame The item sends the output if both inputs have received a non-zero signal within the timeframe. If set to 0, the inputs must receive a signal at the same time. Output The signal sent when both inputs have received a non-zero signal. False Output The signal sent when both inputs have not received a non-zero signal (if empty, no signal is sent). Output The signal this item outputs when the received signal matches the target signal. False Output The signal this item outputs when the received signal does not match the target signal. Target Signal The value to compare the received signals against. Max Power The maximum amount of power that can pass through the item. Is On Can the relay currently pass power and signals through it. Can Be Overloaded Can the item be damaged if too much power is supplied to the power grid. Overload Voltage How much power has to be supplied to the grid relative to the load before item starts taking damage. E.g. a value of 2 means that the grid has to be receiving twice as much power as the devices in the grid are consuming. Fire Probability The probability for a fire to start when the item breaks. Output Type What kind of a signal the item outputs. Pulse: periodically sends out a signal of 1. Sine: sends out a sine wave oscillating between -1 and 1. Square: sends out a signal that alternates between 0 and 1. Frequency How fast the signal oscillates, or how fast the pulses are sent (in Hz). Light Color The color of the emitted light (R,G,B,A). Hud Tint Optional screen tint color when the item is being operated (R,G,B,A). Reload The period of time the user has to wait between shots. Rotation Limits The range at which the barrel can rotate. TODO Spring Stiffness Low Skill How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster. Spring Stiffness High Skill How much torque is applied to rotate the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the barrel rotate faster. Spring Damping Low Skill How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more snappy, stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at. Spring Damping High Skill How much torque is applied to resist the movement of the barrel when the item is used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Higher values make the aiming more snappy, stopping the barrel from swinging around the direction it's being aimed at. Rotation Speed Low Skill Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with insufficient skills to operate it. Rotation Speed High Skill Maximum angular velocity of the barrel when used by a character with sufficient skills to operate it. Base Rotation The angle of the turret's base in degrees. Only Humans Should the sensor only detect the movement of humans? Ignore Dead Should the sensor ignore the bodies of dead characters? Range X Horizontal detection range. Range Y Vertical movement detection range. Detect Offset The position to detect the movement at relative to the item. For example, 0,100 would detect movement 100 units above the item. Output The signal the item outputs when it has detected movement. False Output The signal the item outputs when it has not detected movement. Minimum Velocity How fast the objects within the detector's range have to be moving (in m/s). Output The signal the item sends out when it's underwater. False Output The signal the item sends out when it's not underwater. Range How far the discharge can travel from the item. Range Multiplier In Walls How much further can the discharge be carried when moving across walls. Duration The duration of an individual discharge (in seconds). Outdoors Only If set to true, the discharge cannot travel inside the submarine nor shock anyone inside. Can Be Overloaded Can the item be damaged if too much power is supplied to the power grid. Overload Voltage How much power has to be supplied to the grid relative to the load before item starts taking damage. E.g. a value of 2 means that the grid has to be receiving twice as much power as the devices in the grid are consuming. Fire Probability The probability for a fire to start when the item breaks. Hold Pos The position the character holds the item at (in pixels, as an offset from the character's shoulder). For example, a value of 10,-100 would make the character hold the item 100 pixels below the shoulder and 10 pixels forwards. Hold Angle The rotation at which the character holds the item (in degrees, relative to the rotation of the character's hand). Swing Amount How much the item swings around when aiming/holding it (in pixels, as an offset from AimPos/HoldPos). Swing Speed How fast the item swings around when aiming/holding it (only valid if SwingAmount is set). Swing When Holding Should the item swing around when it's being held. Swing When Aiming Should the item swing around when it's being aimed. Swing When Using Should the item swing around when it's being used (for example, when firing a weapon or a welding tool). Force The force to apply to the user's body. Welcome Message The message to be displayed when opened.
Picking Time How long it takes to pick up the item (in seconds). Can Be Picked Can the item be picked up (or interacted with, if the pick action does something else than picking up the item). Allow In Game Editing Can the properties of the component be edited in-game (only applicable if the component has in-game editable properties). Msg A text displayed next to the item when it's highlighted (generally instructs how to interact with the item, e.g. [Mouse1] Pick up). Min Voltage The minimum voltage required for the device to function. The voltage is calculated as power / powerconsumption, meaning that a device with a power consumption of 1000 kW would need at least 500 kW of power to work if the minimum voltage is set to 0.5. Power Consumption How much power the device draws (or attempts to draw) from the electrical grid when active. Vulnerable To E M P Can the item be damaged by electomagnetic pulses.
The submarine includes a very high number of shadow-casting lights, which can cause performance issues. You may want to go through the light sources and disable shadow casting where possible: dim and/or low-range static lights don't necessarily need to cast shadows if letting the light go through walls and doors is not noticeable, and lights outside the submarine can be set to be drawn behind the submarine so shadows don't need to be cast. View Steam profile All servers Favorites Recent Add to favorites Remove from favorites Casual Having fun is more important than completing the objective. A good choice for new players. Serious The crew should focus on working together efficiently and completing their objective. No unnecessary messing around. Roleplay The crew should aim to act like a real submarine crew. Chain of command is important, as is taking care of your responsibilities and following orders. Speaking out-of-character should be avoided when a round is running. Killing a Moloch A particularly aggressive Moloch has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature. Moloch The Moloch has been killed. Target terminated The Moloch is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Killing a Tiger Thresher A particularly aggressive Tiger Thresher has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to those who kill the creature. Tiger Thresher The Tiger Thresher has been killed. Target terminated The Thresher is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Killing a Hammerhead A particularly aggressive Hammerhead has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to whoever kills the creature. Hammerhead The Hammerhead has been killed. Target terminated The Hammerhead is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Terminate a Swarm A small swarm of [monster] has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it. Swarm The swarm has been terminated. Target terminated The swarm is terminated. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Terminate a Swarm A large swarm of [monster] has been terrorizing vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to any crew that can neutralize it. Swarm The swarm has been terminated. Target terminated The swarm is terminated. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Beast from the Abyss Seismic readings are indicating that something colossal has emerged from the depths of Europa into the passageway between [location1] and [location2]. All transports through the passageway have been canceled for now and a reward of [reward] has been promised to those who get rid of whatever is causing the seismic activity. Target The End Worm is dead and the passageway is open for transport again. Target terminated The beast is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Salvaging an artifact Researchers of [location1] have picked up an infrasonic signal highly similar to those emitted by alien artifacts previously discovered on Europa. Investigate the signal and retrieve the potential artifact. Infrasonic signal It turns out the signal was emitted by a Moloch. The researchers of [location1] have agreed to pay you the reward nevertheless for getting rid of the Moloch. Target terminated Turns out the signal was emitted by a Moloch! You should navigate out of the cavern and inform the researchers. Explosive cargo A local arms dealer is offering [reward] credits in exchange for delivering two crates of high explosives to a customer in [location2]. The explosives have been successfully delivered. Explosive cargo A local arms dealer is offering [reward] credits in exchange for delivering two crates of high explosives to a customer in [location2]. The explosives have been successfully delivered. Chemical shipment Researchers of [location1] need someone to deliver some dangerous chemicals to [location2] for a reward of [reward] credits. The chemicals have been successfully delivered. Biohazard Local researchers are offering [reward] credits for delivering a container of husk parasite eggs to [location2]. The husk eggs have been successfully delivered. Handle with care Local researchers are offering [reward] credits for delivering a large amount of nitroglycerin to [location2]. The chemicals have been successfully delivered. Praise the honkmother A local clown syndicate is offering [reward] credits for delivering a shipment of clowning supplies to [location2]. The clown gear has been successfully delivered. Mining outpost material transport A consignment of materials for construction needs to be transported to [location2] and the crew chief here is prepared to pay [reward] credits for your trouble. The materials have been successfully delivered. Mining outpost material transport The security team at [location2] needs to be resupplied with materials for weapon fabrication. There's [reward] credits for you if you get these supplies to them. The materials have been successfully delivered. Medical item transport A consignment of medical items needs to be transported to [location2]. There's [reward] credits if you can get them there. The materials have been successfully delivered. Personnel transport We have a crew member here who needs to get to [location2] in a hurry. The payment is [reward] credits if you get them there in once piece. The personnel have been successfully delivered. Prospecting The mining crews want to start extracting [resourcename] if you can prove there are enough deposits of it in the area between [location1] and the mining outpost at [location2]. If you can find [quantity] units, you'll be paid a reward of [reward] credits, and you can keep whatever you find. Resource has been prospected successfully. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Medical item transport A crew member over at [location2] has gone and gotten themselves a nasty case of morbusine poisoning. They might stand a chance of survival if you can get a shipment of antidote to them ASAP... You'll be paid [reward] credits on delivery. The antidote has been successfully delivered. Beacon deployment Head over to [location2] and drop a beacon to begin the process of colonizing the area. Payment is [reward] credits when the beacon starts transmitting Beacon deployment location Beacon successfully deployed. Search and destroy A Coalition vessel has been dispatched from [location1] to destroy a renegade vessel at the outskirts of [location2]. A renegade vessel has been detected at the outskirts of [location2]. Treason against the Europa Coalition is punishable by death—eliminate the renegades by any means necessary. You're a member of a renegade group opposing the Europa Coalition. According to your informants at [location1], a Coalition vessel has just been dispatched on a mission to take down your boat. Eliminate their crew by any means necessary. Aggressive Hammerheads According to our sources, there is a group of Hammerheads blocking the route from [location1] to [location2]. Get rid of the creatures so that our vessels can continue traveling safely through the passage. Hammerhead The Hammerheads have been neutralized. The route should be safe again. Targets neutralized The Hammerheads have been neutralized. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Killing a Matriarch A large and hostile creature, a so-called Hammerhead Matriarch, has taken residence in the passageway between [location1] and [location2] along with a swarm of smaller Hammerheads. Kill the creatures so that vessels can continue traveling safely through the route. This might not be the easiest task, but the reward is not small either! Hammerhead The Matriarch has been killed. The route should be safe again. Target terminated The Matriarch and its minions have been taken care of. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Killing a Golden Hammerhead There have been several reports of an aggressive Golden Hammerhead assaulting vessels traveling between [location1] and [location2]. A reward of [reward] credits has been promised to whoever gets rid of the creature. Golden Hammerhead The Golden Hammerhead is dead. Target terminated The Golden Hammerhead is dead. Navigate the submarine out of the cavern to claim the reward. Custom Door A sliding door with no integrated buttons—has to be wired manually. Custom Windowed Door A sliding door with a window. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually. Custom Hatch A door, but on the horizontal axis. No integrated buttons—has to be wired manually. Door with Buttons A sliding door with two integrated buttons. Windowed Door with Buttons A sliding door with a window and two integrated buttons. Hatch with Buttons A door, but on the horizontal axis. Two integrated buttons.
Navigation Terminal Usable device for setting the course of the sub. Shuttle Navigation Terminal Usable device for setting the course of the shuttle. Sonar Monitor Usable device for observing the sub's sonar. Non-interactive. Status Monitor Usable device for viewing a schematic of the sub as well as the status of each room. Sonar Transducer Sonar generator, allowing the sonar monitors and navigation terminals to receive a sonar signal other than the default one (useful for drones and remote-controlled shuttles). Engine Usable device for generating motion on the X axis. Large Engine Usable device for generating motion on the X axis. Shuttle Engine Usable device for generating motion on the X axis. Fabricator A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials. Medical Fabricator A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines. Deconstructor Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars. Oxygen Generator Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks. Shuttle Oxygen Generator Usable device for oxygen generation—must be linked to vents to work. Also recharges oxygen tanks. Vent Oxygen output point. Must be linked to an oxygen generator to work. Pump Usable device for moving water. Small Pump Usable device for moving water. Searchlight Aimable lighting. Nuclear Reactor Usable device for generating electrical power. Coilgun A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies. Coilgun Loader Feeds coilgun ammunition into a linked coilgun. Depth Charge Tube Deploys a depth charge or decoy. Depth Charge Loader Feeds depth charges and decoys into a linked depth charge tube. Electrical Discharge Coil Produces a harmful localized electrical shock across a portion of the adjacent hull. Railgun A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets. Periscope A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun. Railgun Loader Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Railgun Loader Single Vertical Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version. Railgun Loader Single Horizontal Feeds railgun ammunition into a linked railgun. Single shot version.
ID Card Allows limited access to areas of the sub. Alien Pistol A handgun powered by alien power cells. Captain's Cap A token of the captain's unquestionable authority. Captain's Uniform Makes you look like you might be in charge. Health Scanner HUD A heads-up display that shows information about the vital signs and status of nearby humans. Doctor's Uniform Makes you look like you might be useful in a medical emergency. Orange Jumpsuit The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires. Blue Jumpsuit The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires. Toolbox A portable container for storing tools Headset Allows remote communication among the crew. Clown Mask Praise the honkmother. Clown Costume Praise the honkmother. Assistant Clothes Even the assistant needs clothing. Watchman Clothes Makes you look like you might offer a mission to a passerby at any moment. Security Officer's Uniform Obey my authority! Body Armor While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board. Ballistic Helmet While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board. Handcuffs Useful for restraining problem players. Riot Shield Resists damage. Diving Mask Small enough to carry around in case it's needed, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach. Diving Suit An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust. Underwater Scooter A battery-powered underwater propulsion device. Bandage Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns. Plastiseal A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds. Antibiotic Glue An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream. Welding Tool One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater. Plasma Cutter Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen. Welding Fuel Tank Fuel for the welding tool. Oxygen Tank Portable oxygen container. Fire Extinguisher A handheld carbon dioxide extinguisher. Screwdriver Makes electrical repairs and rewiring possible. Wrench Makes mechanical repairs possible. Crowbar Forces doors and hatches open. Also a blunt weapon. Handheld Sonar Portable sonar, handy for exploration. Sonar Beacon Produces a localized signal that can be detected by a sonar monitor, handheld sonar, or navigation terminal. Flashlight Handheld light. Flare Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Alien Flare Temporary handheld light. Useful for marking a path while exploring outside the sub. Burns for longer than a regular flare. Coilgun Ammunition Box Ammunition for the coilgun. Exploding Ammunition Box Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact. Piercing Ammunition Box Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities. Exploding Coilgun Bolt Ammunition for the coilgun. Explodes on impact. Piercing Coilgun Bolt Coilgun ammo that has piercing capabilities. UEX A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus. C-4 Block A stable explosive compound. Compound N A stable explosive compound. Volatile Compound N An unstable explosive compound. IC-4 Block A compound made of C-4 and incendium. Detonator A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal. Harpoon A harpoon for the harpoon gun. Physicorium Harpoon A harpoon for the harpoon gun, made of alien material. Explosive Harpoon A harpoon for the harpoon gun. Harpoon Gun Launches harpoons, explosive harpoons, and alien harpoons. Syringe Gun Launches syrettes containing drugs or poisons. Revolver Round .38 caliber. Might stop a person... Revolver .38 caliber. Stun Grenade Produces bright light and a loud sound on detonation, which stuns nearby characters. EMP Grenade Damages electrical equipment. Frag Grenade General purpose fragmentation grenade. Use carefully. Incendium Grenade Incendiary grenade. Use very carefully. Stun Baton If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a stun baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission. Diving Knife Stabs, pokes, cuts and slashes. Bike Horn HONK! Oxygenite Tank A tank containing liquid Oxygenite. Battery Cell Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells. Fulgurium Battery Cell A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium. Physicorium Body Armor A body armor fabricated from an alien metamaterial. Physicorium Helmet A helmet fabricated from an alien metamaterial. Flamer An incendiary weapon that fires a stream of burning welding fuel. SMG A .45 caliber submachine gun. SMG Magazine A magazine for 15 .45 caliber rounds. SMG Round A .45 caliber submachine gun round. Grenade Launcher A portable grenade launcher for 40mm grenades. 40mm Grenade Ammunition for grenade launcher. 40mm Stun Grenade Ammunition for grenade launcher. Non-lethal. Riot Shotgun A shotgun designed for crowd control. Shotgun Shell Ammunition for a shotgun. Lethal. Stun Gun A device for firing electrified darts. Stun Gun Dart Causes electric shock to incapacitate a target. Non-lethal. Toy Hammer Non-lethal but extremely annoying. Crawler Mask Protects wearer's identity. Fun at certain parties. Husk Stinger A makeshift stabbing tool. Moloch Shell Fragment A sturdy piece of a moloch's shell. Mudraptor Shell A protective shell of a mudraptor. Accordion An old handmade accordion. Bongo Drums An old handmade pair of bongo drums. Captain's Pipe For calming the nerves when the sea is stormy. Incendium Fuel Tank Physicorium Ammunition Box Physicorium Bolt Hazmat Suit Has a protective lead shielding against radiation. Engineer's Jumpsuit Boiler Suit Mechanic's Jumpsuit Veteran's Cap A well-worn cap that has seen many ports. Veteran's Jacket A warm jacket to protect its wearer against the cold depths. Renegade's Hat Strikes fear into the hearts of the Coalition. Renegade's Jacket Indicates who is in charge. Admiral's Hat Admiral's Uniform Commando's Fatigues I ain't got time to bleed. Gunner's Uniform A standard issue gunner's uniform. Gunner's Helmet A bit lighter than a regular ballistic helmet; designed not to get in the way when one is operating a periscope. Riot Helmet Designed for crowd control but equally useful against alien invaders. Medic's Fatigues For frontline medics. Offers some protection against enemies. Baseball Cap Every self-respecting mechanic should have one. Duffel Bag The traditional way of storing a deceased seafarer's belongings until they can be delivered to their next of kin (or stolen or sold).
Junction Box Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices. Battery Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure. Shuttle Battery Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure. Supercapacitor Can deliver charge much faster than batteries. Charging Dock A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock. FPGA Circuit Field-programmable gate array—a multipurpose circuit that can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices. And Component Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other. Adder Component Outputs the sum of the received signals. Or Component Sends a signal if either of the inputs receives a signal. Not Component Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal. Relay Component When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs. Delay Component Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time. Equals Component Sends a signal when both inputs receive the same signal. Greater Component Sends a signal if the value the signal_in1 input is larger than the signal_in2 input. Color Component Outputs a combined color signal for light control. Subtract Component Outputs the subtracted value of the received signals. Multiply Component Outputs the product of the received signals. Divide Component Outputs the divided value of the received signals. Xor Component Sends a signal if either of the inputs, but not both, receives a signal. Memory Component Outputs a stored value that can be updated from other sources. Use the signal_in connection to set the stored value, and the signal_store input to toggle whether the received signals should be stored. Oxygen Detector Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air. Water Detector Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged. Smoke Detector Sends out a signal when it senses smoke. Motion Detector Sends out a signal when it detects movement. Signal Check Component Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received. RegEx Find Component Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern. Oscillator Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal. Wifi Component Allows remote communication between other wifi components that are using the same channel. Camera Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub. Button Produces a signal that can be used to toggle the state of equipment and doors. Switch Produces a constant signal that can be used to change the state of equipment and doors. Lamp Wall-mounted lighting. Emergency Light Wall-mounted lighting. Requires no electrical input. Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Red Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Blue Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Orange Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Green Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Black Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Brown Wire Connects an output from one piece of equipment to an input on another. Light Component Color General purpose lighting. Requires no electrical input. Emergency Siren Can be triggered to make a terrible noise. Alarm Buzzer Can be triggered to make a terrible noise. Beacon When deployed and activated in the correct location, it will signal colonists to come and set up an outpost. Sin Component Outputs the sine of the input. Cos Component Outputs the cosine of the input. Tan Component Outputs the tangent of the input. Asin Component Outputs the angle whose sine is equal to the input. Acos Component Outputs the angle whose cosine is equal to the input. Atan Component Outputs the angle whose tangent is equal to the input. If the signal_in_x and signal_in_y connections are used, the input is interpreted as a vector and the angle calculated using Atan2. Modulo Component Outputs the remainder when the input is divided by a specific number. Round Component Rounds a numerical input to the nearest integer value. Ceil Component Outputs the smallest integer value that is bigger than or equal to the input. Floor Component Outputs the greatest integer value that is less than or equal to the input. Factorial Component Outputs the factorial of the input. Square Root Component Outputs the square root of the input. Abs Component Outputs the absolute value of the input. Exponentiation Component Outputs the input raised to a given power. Terminal Outputs a user-submitted string.
Alien Blood Blood extracted from a Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss. Velonaceps Calyx Eggs Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'. Carbon Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic. Iron Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon. Tin Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components. Lead Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition. Phosphorus Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds. Copper Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring. Zinc Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid. Sodium Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine. Silicon Used as an ingredient in aluminum alloys, plastic and various electrical components. Uranium Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons. Potassium Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water. Magnesium Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water. Lithium Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs. Chlorine Most commonly used in saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative. Slime Bacteria A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics. Titanite A mineral containing titanium and iron. Brockite A mineral containing thorium and phosphorus. Thorianite A rare mineral containing thorium. Amblygonite A mineral composed of lithium, aluminum and sodium. Sphalerite A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form. Pyromorphite A mineral composed of chlorine. Quartz A crystalline mineral composed of silicon. Diamond A crystal composed of solid carbon. Hydroxyapatite A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus. Uranium Ore A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium. Ilmenite A mineral containing titanium. Stannite A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin. Chalcopyrite A mineral containing copper. Esperite A mineral composed of zinc and lead. Galena A mineral mostly consisting of lead. Triphylite A mineral containing lithium. Langbeinite A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium. Chamosite A mineral consisting of iron and aluminum. Iron Ore A mineral containing large amounts of iron. Polyhalite A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium. Graphite Carbon in crystalline form. Sylvite A mineral containing potassium and sodium. Lazulite A mineral containing phosphorus and iron. Bornite A mineral containing copper. Cassiterite A mineral consisting of tin. Cryolite A mineral containing sodium. Aragonite A mineral containing calcium. Chrysoprase A mineral containing silicon. Opium A relatively mild opioid obtained from aquatic poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl. Broad-spectrum Antibiotics A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with the side effect of internal damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds. Stabilozine Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be mildly useful in the treatment of internal damage and burns, and slightly more effective for oxygen deprivation. Ethanol Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised. Sulphuric Acid A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons. Morphine A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse. Fentanyl A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse. Saline A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss. Blood Pack A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss. Deusizine A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and, to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect. Calyxanide An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages. Haloperidol A strong antipsychotic drug. Naloxone An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate-based withdrawal and overdose. Morbusine Antidote An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning. Cyanide Antidote An antidote for acute cyanide poisoning. Sufforin Antidote An antidote for acute sufforin poisoning. Deliriumine Antidote An antidote for acute deliriumine poisoning. Antirad Slows down cellular degradation caused by radiation. Liquid Oxygenite A mildly toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping. Tonic Liquid A medical solution that's mildly effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds. Methamphetamine A potent nervous system stimulant. Anabolic Steroids Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance. Hyperzine An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast. Morbusine A highly potent neurotoxin. Chloral Hydrate A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time. Cyanide A highly potent neurotoxin. Radiotoxin A highly potent neurotoxin. Sufforin A highly potent neurotoxin. Deliriumine A psychosis-inducing toxin. Nitroglycerin A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock. Calcium An element, useful for crafting. Aluminum An element, useful for crafting. Titanium An element, useful for crafting. Thorium An element, useful for crafting. Steel Bar Useful for crafting. Titanium-Aluminum Alloy Useful for crafting. Plastic Useful for crafting. Ballistic Fiber Useful for crafting. Organic Fiber Useful for crafting. Rubber Useful for crafting. Flash Powder Useful for crafting. Incendium Bar Useful for crafting. Fulgurium Bar Useful for crafting. Physicorium Bar Useful for crafting. Dementonite Bar Useful for crafting. Fiber Plant This plant has the texture of a coconut and its fibers move on their own under your fingers unnervingly. Useful for crafting. Elastin Plant The foliage of this plant cannot be torn, only stretched. Useful for crafting. Aquatic Poppy It's warm to the touch. Useful for crafting. Sea Yeast Shroom The smell is beyond belief, like rotting meat on a hot day. Useful for crafting. Elastin A highly elastic, naturally occurring protein. Useful for crafting. Adrenaline A naturally occurring hormone. Useful for crafting.
Swim Bladder Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline. Adrenaline Gland Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor. Guitar An old acoustic guitar. Harmonica An old handmade harmonica. Background Rock 1

Supplies Cabinet Storage for small- and medium-sized items. Medium Steel Cabinet Storage for small- and medium-sized items. Medium Windowed Steel Cabinet Storage for small- and medium-sized items. Large Steel Cabinet Storage for small- and medium-sized items. Secure Steel Cabinet Lockable storage for small- and medium-sized items. Railgun Shell Rack A way to neatly stow railgun shells. Coilgun Ammunition Shelf A way to neatly stow coilgun ammunition. Medicine Cabinet Stow meds here. Toxin Cabinet Stow poisons here. Diving Suit Locker A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit. Large Diving Suit Locker Neatly stores multiple diving suits. Oxygen Tank Shelf Neatly stores multiple oxygen tanks. Metal Crate A vessel in which items may be stored. Secure Metal Crate A secure vessel in which items may be stored. Explosive Crate A vessel in which explosives may be stored. Chemical Crate A vessel in which chemicals may be stored. Fire Extinguisher Bracket Holds a fire extinguisher to the wall. Weapon Holder A place to stow your weapons neatly. Docking Port A vertically aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking port to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations. Docking Hatch A horizontally aligned docking interface. Locks to another docking hatch to form a watertight seal and allow passage between subs, shuttles and locations. Duct Block A mechanically operated vent that may be opened or closed to allow the passage of water. Label Decorative text label. Text Display A scrolling text display. Ladder Allows for vertical locomotion. Fuel Rod A bar of enriched uranium, for use within a reactor. Fulgurium Fuel Rod A bar of enriched fulgurium, for use within a reactor. Generates significantly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods. Thorium Fuel Rod A thorium bar, for use within a reactor. Generates slightly more heat and lasts longer than uranium fuel rods. Coilgun Bolt For firing from a coilgun. Depth Charge Shell A barrel of explosives. Will sink and then explode. Nuclear Depth Charge A barrel of really big explosives. Will sink and then explode. Depth Decoy Shell A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub. Nuclear Depth Decoy A decoy that can be deployed via the depth charge launcher. Will sink while producing a loud acoustic signal to attract attention away from the sub. Railgun Shell For firing from a railgun. Nuclear Shell A nuclear shell for use with a railgun. Physicorium Shell For firing from a railgun. Mudraptor Egg A slimy, pulsating mudraptor egg. The gaping maw on top of the egg seems to be grasping for something to eat. Loose Vent A place to stash things of dubious nature. Loose Panel A place to stash things of dubious nature.

Humpback A former military vessel, WH4-L3 'Humpback' has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. As she's still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment. Bunyip Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between submarines and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board makes it vulnerable to attacks. Muikku The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat. Orca With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel. Remora A range of customization options are available for Remora. In this model, some of the main hull space has been replaced by a detachable ballast and a remote-controlled drone. A large crew is needed to operate this submarine. Typhon Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed. Dugong Compared to larger vessels, the Dugong series is overshadowed in all aspects except one: their reliability for their price is world class. They're lacking in firepower and speed, so smart maneuvering is key. Selkie The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low-capacity batteries limit their range somewhat. Venture Originally intended as research vessels, Venture shuttles have been co-opted as a more robust alternative for travel between outposts and submarines. Berilia Berilia is one of the biggest cargo ships on Europa. Its two engines and three ballasts require a copious amount of power to operate, and keeping the machinery in good working condition is a handful for even a moderately large crew. Kastrull The Kastrull is a dependable attack sub class bringing plenty of firepower to any fight, and although it's not very nimble, it does sport a drone gunship as standard. Keep in mind that with its experimental open ballast tanks, low tolerance to flooding and numerous crew stations, a large, experienced crew will get the most out of this sub. Hemulen For when you need extra room to stretch your legs or want some space between you and the poor, choose Hemulen shuttles. Typhon 2 is an overhauled version of the venerable Typhon class of sub. Serving as a heavy gunship, the Typhon 2 class subs remain slow and ugly, but with the benefit of better survivability for their crews.
Type 'on' or 'off' to either connect batteries to power grid or disconnect them. Enter a number from 0 to 100 to set recharge rate for each battery at once. Enter a value between 0 and 100 to set battery array recharge rate.

The heat is used to spin the turbine, which generates electricity. The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. Internal damage There are signs of burst blood vessels and of organ damage. Died of internal injuries. You have succumbed to your internal injuries. Bleeding Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound. Bled to death. You have bled to death. Burn The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets. The patient is in a great deal of pain. Burned to death. You have burned to death. Oxygen low The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue. Suffocated. You have suffocated. Blood loss The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion. Bled to death. You have bled to death. Stun The patient is dazed and unresponsive. Barotrauma There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze. Crushed by water pressure. You have been crushed by water pressure. Husk infection Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat. Taken over by a husk parasite. You have been taken over by the husk parasite. Psychosis The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events. Drunk The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus. Died of alcohol poisoning. You have died of alcohol poisoning. Opiate withdrawal Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea. Died of opiate withdrawal. You have died of opiate withdrawal. Opiate overdose The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow. Died of opiate overdose. You have died of opiate overdose. Opiate addiction The patient is happy enough...so long as they get what they need. Gunshot wound The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound, however, is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue, and it's pouring blood. Shot to death. You have died of gunshot wounds. Morbusine poisoning The patient can't breathe at all, and their heart rate is slowing rapidly. Died of morbusine poisoning. You have died of morbusine poisoning. Sufforin poisoning Without prompt treatment, sufforine poisoning leads to delusions and rapid death. Died of sufforin poisoning. You have died of sufforin poisoning. Cyanide poisoning The patient is confused and has trouble breathing. Their skin is red and they have occasional muscle spasms. Died of cyanide poisoning. You have died of cyanide poisoning. Blunt force trauma The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken. Died of blunt force trauma. You have succumbed to injuries from blunt force trauma. Lacerations The skin is pierced and there are deep, bleeding wounds. Died of lacerations. You have succumbed to your wounds. Bite wounds There is extensive damage to soft tissue in the area and there are asymmetrical, bleeding wounds. Mauled to death. You have been mauled to death. Radiation sickness The patient's skin is red and blistering. Deliriumine poisoning The patient seems agitated, with small but noticeable nervous twitches in their face and hands.
Slow metabolism Causes chemicals to last longer. Hyperactivity Movement speed and reflexes are heightened. Husk infection resistance Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites. Psychosis resistance Patient exhibits high mental fortitude. Pressure resistance Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures. Vigor Patient's pain receptors are numbed.
Captain The commanding officer is responsible for commanding the entirety of the crew and ensuring that everything is running smoothly. Engineer Engineers are the backbone of a submarine's crew, complementing a mechanic's mechanical engineering skill with their knowledge of electrical engineering. They are capable of performing maintenance on the various electrical pieces of the submarine. Mechanic Mechanics are capable of fixing various mechanical devices with their high mechanical engineering skill. Together with engineers they ensure a submarine is working to its fullest. Security Officer Security Officers are responsible for keeping the submarine safe from threats, both external and internal. The creatures inhabiting the ocean aren't the only threat they need to worry about, as several of the renegade groups opposing the Europa Coalition are known to have sent infiltrators on board the vessels. Medical Doctor Although usually taken for granted, doctors play an important role on the submarine, possessing the required skill to treat injured or unconscious crew members. Their skills can also be useful for creating various non-medicinal chemicals. Assistant Assistants don't have any specific responsibilities or areas of expertise. This job is a good choice for newcomers who want to get a hang of working on board the submarine without taking up tasks that they aren't qualified for. Watchman
A veteran of Europan seas, this captain either inspires loyalty in their crew or keeps them in line by force. Renegade captains are a thorn in the establishment's side. They use a combination of daring and aggressive maneuvers to keep the Coalition off balance. Captains of the Coalition adhere to a strict set of rules. That doesn't stop them from coming up with new innovations to hunt down their enemies. Nuclear engineers are in charge of the sub's reactor. Occupational hazards require them to wear some protective gear against radiation. The submarine's fickle electrical systems need constant maintenance. The dubious honor of replacing fuses, hooking up devices with power and taking numerous electric shocks falls to electrical engineers. Commandos are a special breed of security officer. They only have a single purpose: destroy the enemy, whether it's at range or mano a mano. These peacekeepers are dedicated to keeping the peace at any cost. Preferably but not necessarily using non-lethal force. Submarine gunners are trained not only to shoot accurately with coil and railguns but also to keep them in working condition. Administering first aid often requires venturing into dangerous areas. These front-line medics have gear that offers them some protection against monsters and guns, while not compromising their mobility. These doctors are prepared to treat most, if not all, injuries that threaten the crew on lengthy trips underwater.
